labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to facilitate code review and analysis using AI-powered tools. Its primary functionality involves examining codebases for quality, security, performance, and maintainability issues. The available tools focus on repository analysis and comprehensive, actionable code reviews, making it particularly useful for developers, development teams, and organizations that prioritize code quality and best practices.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" was chosen because the server's core functionality directly supports software development through code analysis and review. Secondary labels like "Code Quality & Best Practices" and "AI/ML Tools" were selected because the server leverages AI to provide insights into code quality and adheres to best practices in the development workflow. While the predefined categories don't perfectly capture all nuances, they provide the closest match to the server's purposes.

tools.name: analyze_repo
tools.description: Use this tool when you need to analyze a code repository structure without performing a detailed review. This tool flattens the repository into a textual representation and is ideal for getting a high-level overview of code organization, directory structure, and file contents. Use it before code_review when you need to understand the codebase structure first, or when a full code review is not needed.

repoPath.description: Path to the repository to analyze

fileTypes.description: File types to include in the analysis

tools.name: code_review
tools.description: Use this tool when you need a comprehensive code review with specific feedback on code quality, security issues, performance problems, and maintainability concerns. This tool performs in-depth analysis on a repository or specific files and returns structured results including issues found, their severity, recommendations for fixes, and overall strengths of the codebase. Use it when you need actionable insights to improve code quality or when evaluating a codebase for potential problems.

repoPath.description: Path to the repository to analyze

fileTypes.description: File types to include in the review

detailLevel.description: Level of detail for the code review

focusAreas.description: Areas to focus on during the code review

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@crazyrabbitLTC/mcp-code-review-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
